showScoreExcerpt:
Despite the brilliance of Danny DeVito and the cleverness of the concept of a story about hoarders who keep items for emotional significance, I had difficulty getting into this production. It felt to me like watching a sitcom being filmed. The emotional highs weren’t that high, the lows weren’t that low, and the character development was minimal. Had I watched this play in 20 minute increments once a week, I would have looked forward to each character’s lovable familiarity and role in the story.

Read more

keyPhrases.quote: I had difficulty getting into this production.
